data.event: On August 18, 1827, Joseph Holman bought land near the confluence of the Mississinewa and Wabash Rivers from John B. Richardville, the chief of the Miami Indians.
The sale was approved on March 3, 1828 by President John Quincy Adams.

event.title: March 12, 1829, Holman had the land surveyed

data.event: On March 12, 1829, Holman had the land surveyed and laid out into the town of Miamisport.
Peru was founded in 1834 by William N. Hood, who had bought 210 acres of land from Miamisport's founder Joseph Holman five years earlier.

event.title: had bought 210 acres of land from Miamisport's founder Joseph Holman five years earlier

data.event: Peru was founded in 1834 by William N. Hood, who had bought 210 acres of land from Miamisport's founder Joseph Holman five years earlier.
By 1835, court was being held in Peru rather than Miamisport, and the name "Miamisport" quietly disappeared as Peru became the dominant community in the area.

event.title: was reunited with members of her family near Peru in 1837

data.event: Frances Slocum was reunited with members of her family near Peru in 1837, after nearly sixty years of captivity among Native Americans.
